{{Infobox company | name = Nexcelle | logo = Nexcelle-logo-vert.jpg | logo_size = 220px | location = [[Cincinnati, Ohio]], [[United States|U.S.]] | key_people = {{nowrap | Ken Onderko (President)}} | industry = [[Aerospace manufacturer|Aerospace]] | products = Integrated propulsion systems
Nacelle systems | homepage = [http://www.nexcelle.com/index/ www.nexcelle.com] }} '''Nexcelle''' is a [[joint venture]] between [[GE Aviation]]’s [http://www.mras-usa.com ''Middle River Aircraft Systems''] and [[Safran]] Nacelles – both of which are suppliers of engine [[nacelle]]s, [[thrust reverser]]s and [[aerostructures]]. Headquartered in [[Cincinnati]], [[Ohio]], Nexcelle has teamed with its parent companies to develop, produce and support integrated propulsion systems for jet engine applications on single-aisle jetliners and business aircraft. With its initial program win, Nexcelle is positioned as a key partner on the world’s first truly integrated propulsion system, the [[CFM International]] LEAP-1C engine on China’s COMAC C919 jetliner. The joint venture subsequently was selected to provide the nacelle and thrust reverser for GE’s Passport integrated propulsion system, which powers the [[Bombardier Aerospace|Bombardier]] [[Bombardier Global Express|Global 7000]] and [[Bombardier Global Express|Global 8000]] business jets. ==History== [[GE Aviation]] and [[Safran]] announced an agreement on a new nacelle joint venture on July 15, 2008 at the [[Farnborough Airshow]] in [[Farnborough, Hampshire|Farnborough]], England. Nexcelle was announced as the name of the new company on September 21, 2009. On June 14, 2009, the appointment of Steve Walters as Nexcelle president was announced at the [[Paris Air Show]]. Walters had worked in various engineering and leadership roles, with the majority of his career at GE – including two of his most recent roles as director of Business Operations for the [[CFM International CFM56|CFM56]] engine program and the airfoils business Quality and Compliance leader for [[GE Aviation]]. Also at the 2009 [[Paris Air Show]], Nexcelle’s cooperative nacelle systems agreement with [[CFM International]] was detailed. This accord covers the development and production of integrated propulsion systems for potential new applications for CFM engines. Michel J. Abella was announced as the Director of Programs at Nexcelle on December 18, 2009. In December, 2009, Nexcelle became a partner on the world's first truly integrated propulsion system. The company was selected to provide a combined nacelle, thrust reverser and exhaust system for the new [[CFM International]] [[CFM International LEAP-X|LEAP-1C]] engine selected as the sole western powerplant to launch [[China]]’s [[COMAC C919]] jetliner. Nexcelle’s contribution to [[CFM International LEAP-X|LEAP-1C]] on the [[COMAC C919|C919]] includes an innovative nacelle design that is produced with a significant percentage of composites, and which incorporates advanced acoustic treatment. It also is to be equipped with an Electrical Thrust Reverser Actuation System (ETRAS). [[File:Nexcelle PANACHE.jpg|thumb|The Nexcelle PANACHE thrust reverser demonstrator is deployed during testing at GE Aviation’s Peebles, Ohio facility. An anti-ingestion tunnel protects the CFM56-5C testbed engine against FOD ([[foreign object damage]]) during thrust reverse. (May 16, 2012)]] In October 2010, GE selected Nexcelle to provide the nacelle and thrust reverser for the GE Passport 20 engine to be used on [[Bombardier Aerospace|Bombardier]]’s new [[Bombardier Global Express|Global 7000]] and [[Bombardier Global Express|Global 8000]] business jets. The announcement was made at the [[National Business Aviation Association|NBAA]] Annual Meeting and Convention. At the [[Paris Air Show]] in June 2011, Nexcelle signed the purchase agreement for its supply of the [[General Electric Passport|GE Passport]] 20’s nacelle system to [[GE Aviation]]. Nexcelle’s presence at the 2011 [[Paris Air Show]] also included a functional half-scale model demonstrating key elements of the company’s integrated propulsion system concepts for jet engines on airliners. In January 2012, Nexcelle announced the appointment of Huntley Myrie as its new president – succeeding the company’s first president, Steve Walters, who moved on to become the product leader for [[GE Aviation]]’s nacelle and aerostructures activities. Nexcelle began full-scale testing of its nacelle demonstrator – called PANACHE (Pylon And Nacelle Advanced Configuration for High Efficiency) – in May 2012, marking a first validation of the thrust reverser element for the company’s Integrated Propulsion System technology. This activity occurred at GE Aviation’s Peebles Test Operation in Ohio, and it involved 200 cycles representing normal deployments, rejected take-off deployments and aborted landings. Michel Abella was appointed president of Nexcelle in August 2013. Ken Onderko took over the role in December 2016. ==Notes== {{Reflist|refs= [http://www.atwonline.com/news/story.html?storyID=18935 ''Air Transport World''], Published: December 24, 2009 [http://www.aviationweek.com/aw/generic/story_airshow.jsp?channel=busav&id=news/NAC020110.xml&show=sing10 ''Aviation Week & Space Technology''], John Morris, "High Tech Nacelle for C919 Said To Be World First," Published: February 1, 2010 [http://www.flightglobal.com/articles/2008/07/17/225790/safran-and-ge-form-nacelle-joint-venture.html ''Flight International''], "Safran and GE form nacelle joint venture," Published: July 7, 2008 [http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=3237775 ''Business Week''], "Nexcelle, Middle River Aircraft Systems and Aircelle Company Formed Joint Venture to Develop Engine Nacelles," Published: July 7, 2008 [http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=3237775 ''Business Week''], "Middle River Aircraft Systems/Aircelle Names Steve Walters as President," Published: July 7, 2008 [http://www.airframer.com/news_story.html?release=5100 ''Airframer''], "New engine nacelle joint venture of Middle River Aircraft Systems and Aircelle signs cooperative agreement with CFM International," Published: July 18, 2009 [http://www.nexcelle.com ''www.nexcelle.com''], Retrieved: February 26, 2010 [http://www.flightglobal.com/articles/2010/10/21/348666/nbaa-bombardier-globals-get-nexcelle-treatment.html ''Flightglobal''], "NBAA: Bombardier Globals get Nexcelle treatment," Published: October 21, 2010 [http://www.zacks.com/stock/news/56125/GE+Gets+Orders+Worth+$27B ''Zacks Investment Research''], "GE Gets Orders Worth $27B," Published: June 29, 2011 [https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=conewsstory&tkr=CLRT:US&sid=auQ8XAXdUvJs ''Bloomberg''], "Nexcelle Unveils Next-Generation Integrated Propulsion System (IPS) Concepts for Jet Engines on Airliner," Published: June 16, 2011 [http://www.nexcelle.com ''www.nexcelle.com''], Retrieved: January 25, 2012 [http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/nexcelle-completes-key-c919-nacelle-test-373337/ ''Flightglobal''], John Croft, "Nexcelle completes key C919 nacelle test," Published: June 22, 2012 [http://www.nexcelle.com ''www.nexcelle.com''], Retrieved: October 16, 2017 [http://www.nexcelle.com ''www.nexcelle.com''], Retrieved: October 16, 2017 }} [[Category:Joint ventures]] [[Category:Aerospace companies]]

{{EngvarB|date=July 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = Nicky Oppenheimer | image = File:Vladimir Putin in South Africa 5-6 September 2006-16.jpg | caption = Oppenheimer (right) with Russian President Vladimir Putin in 2006. | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1945|06|08}} | birth_place = South Africa | residence = South Africa | occupation = Businessman | salary = | networth = {{USD}}7.6 [[1000000000 (number)|billion]] (November 2018)<ref name="Forbes profile">{{cite web |title=Forbes profile: Nicky Oppenheimer & family |url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/nicky-oppenheimer/ |website=Forbes |accessdate=23 November 2018}}</ref> | spouse = Orcillia Lasch | children = [[Jonathan Oppenheimer]] | father = [[Harry Frederick Oppenheimer]] | mother = Bridget (née McCall) Oppenheimer }}
'''Nicholas F. Oppenheimer''' (born 8 June 1945) is a South African [[billionaire]] businessman and philanthropist. He was formerly the chairman of [[De Beers]] diamond mining company and of its subsidiary, the [[Diamond Trading Company]], and former deputy chairman of [[Anglo American plc|Anglo American]]. He is the second richest African.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/africa-billionaires/list/|title=Africa's 50 Richest List|date=2017|author=[[Forbes]]}}</ref>
==Early life== Nicholas is the son of Bridget (née McCall) and [[Harry Oppenheimer]], and grandson of [[Ernest Oppenheimer]], founder of [[Anglo American plc|Anglo American]] and the first generation of the family to chair (from 1929) the [[De Beers]] diamond mining company in South Africa, established by [[Cecil John Rhodes]] in 1888.<ref>[http://www.debeersgroup.com/en/our-story/our-history.html De Beers: "Our History"] 2014</ref> His father was of German Jewish descent. Oppenheimer was educated at [[Harrow School]] and [[Christ Church, Oxford]], where he read [[Philosophy, Politics and Economics]] and took the [[Master of Arts (Oxbridge)|Oxford MA]].<ref>[http://www.debswana.com/About%20Debswana/Board%20of%20Directors/Pages/Nicky%20Oppenheimer.aspx DEbswana: "Nicky Oppenheimer"] 2000</ref>
==Business career== Oppenheimer joined the [[Anglo American plc|Anglo American]] Corporation in 1968, and was appointed a director in 1974. He became deputy chairman in 1983. He subsequently resigned in 2001 but remained a non-executive director until 2011.
Oppenheimer was appointed deputy chairman of the then Central Selling Organisation (now [[Diamond Trading Company]]) in 1984 and deputy chairman of [[De Beers]] Consolidated Mines in 1985. He was appointed chairman of the Diamond Trading Company in 1985.<ref>[http://www.miningweekly.com/article/mining-man-2012-08-24 Mining Weekly: "De Beers' Nicky oppenheimer to receive lifetime achievement award"] 24 August 2012</ref> He was chairman of the De Beers Group from 1998 to 2012, at which point he retired when the family stake was sold to Anglo American.<ref>[http://rough-polished.com/en/expertise/58666.html Rough and Polished: "After De Beers, what's next for the Oppenheimers?"] 12 January 2012</ref>
==Philanthropy== The Oppenheimer family has directed much of its philanthropic efforts towards preserving the heritage and cultural importance of the Southern African region, as well as to broader community upliftment in the areas of education, health, nature conservation and the arts. Nicky Oppenheimer and his son [[Jonathan Oppenheimer]] established the [[Brenthurst Foundation]] in 2005 as a way to contribute to the debate around strategies and policies for strengthening Africa's economic performance and enabling inclusive and [[sustainable development]]. The family has also long been involved in environmental and [[conservation (ethic)|conservation]] issues.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.tswalu.com/about-us/the-oppenheimer-story|title=The Oppenheimer Story {{!}} Tswalu Kalahari|website=www.tswalu.com|access-date=2017-09-12}}</ref> The Oppenheimer family partnered with [[De Beers]] to establish the Diamond Route in 2006 to maximise the potential of their properties for conservation, research and environmental awareness purposes. The Diamond Route links 8 sites across northern South Africa, stretching from [[Namaqualand]] on the west coast, to [[Kimberley, Northern Cape|Kimberley]], north to Tswalu in the [[Kalahari]], and to the Brenthurst Gardens in [[Johannesburg]], eastwards to Ezemvelo Nature Reserve and northwards to the [[Venetia Limpopo Nature Reserve]] in Limpopo Province.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.diamondroute.com/our-story.htm|title=The Diamond Route Story|last=Mostert|first=© Duncan MacFadyen, © Warwick|website=www.diamondroute.com|access-date=2017-09-12}}</ref> Since 2015 Oppenheimer is also a [[Rhodes House|Rhodes Trustee]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.rhodeshouse.ox.ac.uk/about/trustees/|title=Current Trustees|website=Rhodes House|language=en|access-date=22 November 2018}}</ref>
==Awards== In 2003, the [[Technikon Witwatersrand]] awarded Oppenheimer an honorary doctorate.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/profiles/people/1476188-nicholas-frank-oppenheimer|title=Nicholas Oppenheimer, Anglo American Gold Investment Co Ltd: Profile & Biography|website=Bloomberg|access-date=2017-09-12}}</ref> He received the Presidential Order of Honor (2004) from the former President of [[Botswana]], [[Festus Mogae]],<ref>[http://polishedprices.com/go/market-news/weekly-market-reports~4612 Polished Prices: "Weekly Market Report"] 5 September 2010</ref> and an honorary fellowship (2009) from the [[London Business School]].<ref>[http://www.israelidiamond.co.il/English/NEWS.aspx?boneID=918&objID=7812&SearchS=nicky+oppenheimer Israeli Diamond: "Nicky Oppenheimer Takes helm as Debswana Chairman"] 1 September 2010</ref>
==Personal life== In 1968, he married Orcillia "Strilli" Lasch, daughter of industrial tycoon Helli Lasch; both are [[Anglicanism|Anglican]]. His father was born Jewish and converted to Anglicanism.<ref name=jbn>{{cite news |url=http://jewishbusinessnews.com/2013/06/11/diamonds-may-not-be-for-ever-but-at-the-moment-they-look-pretty-good |title=Diamonds May Not Be For Ever – But at the Moment They Look Pretty Good |work=[[Jewish Business News]] |author=Minchom, Clive |date=11 June 2013 |access-date=3 May 2014 }}</ref>
==Publications== * {{cite book |title=Waltham Place: and its Surrounding Parish |publication-date=2001 |author1=Over, Luke |author2=Oppenheimer, Nicky |author3=Tyrrell, Chris (illustrator) |isbn=0-9541669-0-6 |publisher= |location= }}<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/Waltham-Place-And-Surrounding-Parish/dp/0954166906 |publisher=Amazon.com |title=Waltham Place: and its Surrounding Parish |author=Nicholas Oppenheimer |date=November 2001 }}</ref>
==Footnotes== {{Reflist|2}}
==External links== *[http://www.debeersgroup.com/debeersweb/About+De+Beers/De+Beers+Structure/Directorate/Nicky+F+Oppenheimer.htm Biography from De Beers] *[http://www.walthamplace.com Oppenheimer's Waltham Place Gardens and Farm] *[https://www.theguardian.com/southafrica/story/0,13262,1519700,00.html Interview in ''The Guardian'', 2005] *[http://www.economist.com/people/displayStory.cfm?story_id=1974148 Profile in ''The Economist'', 2003]
{{s-start}} {{succession box | before=[[Harry Frederick Oppenheimer]] | title=[[De Beers Consolidated Mines|Chairman of De Beers Consolidated Mines]] | years=circa 1983–2012 | after=[[Cynthia Carroll]]}} {{s-end}} {{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Oppenheimer, Nicky}} <!-- Categories --> [[Category:1945 births]] [[Category:Alumni of Christ Church, Oxford]] [[Category:South African mining businesspeople]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Diamond dealers]] [[Category:Oppenheimer family|Nicky]] [[Category:People educated at Harrow School]] [[Category:South African Anglicans]] [[Category:South African billionaires]] [[Category:South African businesspeople]] [[Category:South African people of German-Jewish descent]] [[Category:Rhodes Trustees]]

'''The PromaxBDA Awards''' (also known as the Promax Awards) honor promotion, design and marketing<ref>{{cite news|url= http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117897883.html?categoryid=19&cs=1&query=promax+award|publisher= Variety| title= Promax & BDA skeds Euro speakers| date= January 6, 2004| author= Bobbie Whiteman}}</ref> by a company or individual that is broadcast, published or released in their respective markets.<ref name="Daily Brand">{{cite web|url=http://www.thedailybrand.com/WordPress/?p=220|title=Colin Mangham to Judge Promax/BDA Awards|date=May 1, 2009|publisher=The Daily Brand|accessdate=March 24, 2010}}{{dead link|date=April 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
PromaxBDA sponsors awards competitions at the global level, as well as in North America, Latin America, Europe, the United Kingdom, Africa, Asia, India, and Australia & New Zealand. There is also a competition at the local level in the United States and Canada.
The awards categories include [[network TV]], [[TV stations]], cable networks, cable systems, network radio, [[radio stations]], syndication distributors, and [[interactive media]]. At one point they also included [[Brandon Tartikoff]] Award,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117797481.html?categoryid=14&cs=1&query=promax+conference|title= Wolf, Mandabach at Promax| author= Mary Sutter| date= April 19, 2001 | work=Variety}}</ref> although it has not been awarded in several years.
Winners in the past have included [[FX Networks]], [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]], [[Red Bee Media]], [[HBO]], [[A+E Networks]], 4Creative, Les Télécréateurs Paris<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blog.lenodal.com/index.php?/plugin/tag/promax|title=BLOG.lenodal.com : actualité des identités [télé]visuelles|website=blog.lenodal.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://blog.lenodal.com/index.php?/archives/0256-Les-laureats-francais-des-Promax-World-2014.html|title=BLOG.lenodal.com : Les lauréats français des Promax World 2014|website=blog.lenodal.com}}</ref>, Rogers Media and Bell Media Agency.
The PromaxBDA Global Excellence and North America Awards are handed out each year at PromaxBDA's annual conference in June, which alternates between New York City and Los Angeles.
==Promax and Broadcast Design Association== Promax was established in 1956 as a non-profit association for promotion and marketing professionals working in broadcast media. In 1997, The Broadcast Design Association (BDA) who had partnered with Promax for years on their annual conference, officially joined with Promax.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.promaxbda.org/about.asp?n=promaxbda|publisher=PromaxBDA|accessdate=2009-04-19|title=WHO IS PROMAX·BDA?|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090419223450/http://www.promaxbda.org/about.asp?n=promaxbda|archivedate=2009-04-19|df=}}</ref>
The PromaxBDA awards replaced earlier awards presented separately by Promax and the Broadcast Designers Association (BDA). Thousands of PromaxBDA awards have been presented to [[Company (law)|companies]] and [[individual]]s whose work is judged by a panel of [[promotion (marketing)|promotion]] and [[marketing]] professionals using three measures: overall creativity, production quality, and results in achieving marketing objectives.
==PromaxBDA== PromaxBDA is a nonprofit professional association based in Los Angeles, with a branch office in Singapore. PromaxBDA describes itself as "the global association for the entertainment marketing industry, representing thousands of people who create, market, and distribute content in media."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://promaxbda.org/about/mission|title=PromaxBDA - About Us|website=promaxbda.org}}</ref> Founded in the United States in 1956 as the Broadcast Promotion Association (BPA), in 1985, the organization changed its name to Broadcast Promotion & Marketing Executives (BPME). In 1993, the organization again changed its name to PROMAX (a loose acronym for Promotion and Marketing Executives).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.museum.tv/eotv/broadcastpro.htm|title=The Museum of Broadcast Communications - Encyclopedia of Television - Broadcast Promotion and Marketing Executives|website=www.museum.tv}}</ref> A merger with the Broadcast Design Association (BDA) in 1997 created the current association: PromaxBDA. The legal name for the group, which has [https://www.irs.gov/charities-non-profits/other-non-profits/business-leagues 501(c)6] status from the IRS, is Promax International BPME.
The association holds conferences, [[award]] competitions and prints publications <ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.multichannel.com/article/450864-VISIONARIES_INNOVATORS_POWER_BROKERS_40_Under_Forty.php| publisher= Multichannel news| date= March 29, 2010| title= VISIONARIES INNOVATORS POWER BROKERS: 40 Under Forty|accessdate= May 4, 2010}}</ref> for their members, and present [[Social network|networking]] opportunities.<ref name ="Daily Brand"/> Steve Kazanjian is the current President & CEO.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/steve-kazanjian-appointed-ceo-promaxbda-752932|title=Steve Kazanjian Appointed CEO of PromaxBDA |publisher=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=30 April 2015}}</ref> The Board of Directors is composed of senior entertainment marketing executives, and is currently chaired by Steph Sebbag, CEO of Los Angeles-based creative agency BPG. Previous PromaxBDA chairs include Joe Earley, President, The Jackal Group (formerly COO, [[21st Century Fox|Fox Television Group]], <ref>{{cite web|url=https://promaxbda.org/about/board-of-directors|publisher=PromaxBDA|title=About: Board of Directors |accessdate=30 April 2015}}</ref>, Lisa Gregorian, President & CMO, Warner Bros. Television Group,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.warnerbros.com/studio/wb-executives/divisional-executives/lisa-gregorian|title=Lisa Gregorian|website=www.warnerbros.com}}</ref>, Adam Stotsky, Pres. and GM, E!<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/promaxbda-names-two-co-chairmen-24511|title=PromaxBDA names two co-chairmen|publisher=}}</ref>, and Mike Benson, Head of Marketing, Amazon Studios <ref>https://www.linkedin.com/in/mibenson/</ref>.
PromaxBDA publishes the Daily Brief newsletter.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.promaxbda.org/brief|title=- PromaxBDA Brief|website=www.promaxbda.org}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|2}}
==External links== * [http://www.promaxbda.org/ PromaxBDA website]
[[Category:Advertising awards]]

The '''Rapaport Price List''', also known as the "Rap List" is the [[diamond industry]] standard for the pricing of diamonds.
==History== The first Rapaport Price List was produced by [[Martin Rapaport]], the Rapaport Diamonds Group founder, in 1978<ref>{{cite web |title=The Industry’s Benchmark: Rapaport Price list |url=https://en.israelidiamond.co.il/wikidiamond/diamond-industry-history/benchmark-rapaport-price-list/ |website=The Israeli Diamond Insustry |accessdate=16 July 2018}}</ref>.
==How it works== The report is updated every week on Thursday, at 11:59pm EST. The Rapaport Price List is [[Copyright|copyrighted]] and available only to subscribers. Jewelers and diamond merchants use it to set prices for consumers. Consumers should therefore use the report with caution.<ref>{{cite web |title=Traps with Raps |url=https://www.pricescope.com/wiki/wholesale-diamonds/traps_with_raps |website=PriceScope |accessdate=10 July 2018}}</ref> These prices are used as the basis for standardization and negotiation of diamond prices around the world. Many of the agreed upon prices in diamond trade are come to from discounts based on the Rapaport Price List.
==What is the report based on?== The report is issued in the form of a table and prices diamonds based on their [[Carat (mass)|size]], [[Diamond color|color]] and [[Diamond clarity|clarity]]. The report provides prices for individual diamonds and not diamonds sold in bulk.<ref name=":0">{{cite web |title=Learn How to Calculate Diamond Prices So You Don’t Get Ripped Off & Overpay |url=https://www.diamonds.pro/education/diamond-prices/ |website=The Diamond Pro |accessdate=10 July 2018}}</ref>
==How to read the report== Each price list has four separate grids each one containing information for a different carat size for diamonds. Each grid has the clarity options on the horizontal line and the color options on the vertical line. In order to calculate the price of a diamond according to the Rapaport Price List, you need to know the size, color and clarity of the diamond. The price listed based on this information is in hundreds of dollars per carat.<ref name=":0" />
==See also== *[[Diamonds as an investment]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *{{official website|http://www.diamonds.net}} *[http://designbysevan.com/how-to-buy-perfect-diamond-and-how-you-compare-diamond-price/ How To Compare Diamond Price?]
[[Category:Diamond industry]]

The '''registrar''' is a Chief Executive officer of a judicial forum. They are the in charge of the entire registry of the department.
In [[common law]] jurisdictions, registrars are usually judicial officers with the power to hear certain civil matters such as interlocutory applications and assessment of damages. In some jurisdictions they may also hear trials of cases if both parties consent.<ref>See for example in New Zealand http://www.justice.govt.nz/publications/global-publications/m/media-guide-for-reporting-the-courts-and-tribunals-edition-3.1/3-0-key-participants-for-media-in-the-court/3-2-court-registrar</ref> Registrars are assisted by Deputy-Registrars, who in [[common law]] jurisdictions are sometime called [[Master (judiciary) |masters]].<ref>For example in England and Hong Kong</ref>
The Registrar is the chief administrator of the department, normally they happen to be the Head of the Department. The posts of the Registrar are generally created in judicial forum like tribunals, High Courts and Supreme Court and in educational universities. In judicial forum they manage both administrative and judicial sides in departments under the authority of the president/Chairman of the tribunals and Chief justices of the High Courts and Supreme Court. The Government may also appoint one or more Assistant/Deputy Registrars. They help the Courts, the Registrar, the President/Chairman and the Judges in all their official/ judicial functions. They are exercising delegated powers of the Registrar. They are Guardian of the Seals and responsible for the Court's archives and publications.
The Registrar is responsible for the administrative and few judicial work as are assigned by the President/ Chairman/Judges of the tribunal/Court. In the event of necessities the Registrar may pass interlocutory orders for staying the proceedings as he deems fit until the appeal is heard by the other courts.
In other jurisdictions, the Registrar exercises his powers with the change of nomenclature. Normally, the status of the Registrar is equal to that of the District Judge of Higher Judicial Service.
==Hong Kong==
The court's Registrar, Senior Deputy Registrars and Deputy Registrars serve as [[Master (judiciary)|Masters]] of the High Court in civil trials in the Court of First Instance.<ref>[http://www.yearbook.gov.hk/2001/ehtml/03/03-08f.htm 2001 Hong Kong Government Year Book]</ref>
==Singapore==
The Supreme Court Registry is currently headed by the Registrar of the Supreme Court. He is assisted by the Deputy Registrar, Senior Assistant Registrars and the Assistant Registrars who perform judicial functions. Certain civil proceedings in the High Court, which are heard in chambers, are dealt with by the Registrars.<ref>[http://app.supremecourt.gov.sg/default.aspx?pgID=40 Singapore Supreme Court website]</ref>
==References==
